sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>fins</radical> that fell onto my <radical>sword</radical> were sliced into two <kanji>part</kanji>s.
meaningInfo: The logic of this story makes a lot of sense - even in the kanji itself the fins are falling onto the sword from above. What happens to things that fall onto swords? They become more than one <kanji>part</kanji>.
readingMnemonic: Now that you've cut the fish, it's time to cut something else into <kanji>part</kanji>s. Next on your list is the <reading>bun</reading>s (<ja>ぶん</ja>), which need to be split up amongst the people.
readingInfo: Think about the <reading>bun</reading>s (<ja>ぶん</ja>) as absolutely delicious things you want to eat really bad. And since you've cut them into carefully portioned parts, you can share them with all your friends!
